history.content:
📣 We'd like to share an amazing opportunity, particularly for you juniors and seniors wondering how to get a job or internship this summer, though we encourage all to apply!
Now in its 3rd year, the MLH Fellowship has 700+ global alumni. What started in 2020 in response to the pandemic is currently a growing internship alternative for aspiring software engineers around the world. The 12-week fellowship is project-based, 100% remote, and focused on learning Open Source projects and best practices. Admitted fellows are matched to a company, grouped with peers, and work on OS projects from companies like Meta, AWS, GitHub, and Solana Labs. During the program, Fellows will:
- Learn to and create production-quality Open Source contributions for their matched project
- Build a network of amazing fellows, maintainers, and mentors to learn with/from
- Gain access to stipends, live technical training, and career support
Best of all, many fellows end up working as interns or full-time employees for their matched company after the program.
The summer program starts on 5/31, and applications are open now. If you’re interested in learning more, here are two ways:
- The MLH team is hosting an Info Session on Twitch next week w/ former fellows & mentors. RSVP here: https://hackp.ac/xpBcUv
- Follow MLH on LinkedIn for up-to-date info & fellow/partner stories: https://www.linkedin.com/company/major-league-hacking
